intro: Onosma estahbanensis, commonly known as Estahban thyme, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its essential oils are also valued for their aromatic and potential therapeutic properties.
